update.description:
The reason this is so big is because cppcheck wanted an `explicit` constructor for `Angle::Angle(double)`. This caused compilation failures because we were using implicit conversion from double to `Angle`.

So, I added proper operator overloads for doubles, and also added two literal functions:

1. `_ign_deg`
2. `_ign_rad`

This is the first time I've define a literal, so suggestions are welcome.
update.title: Fix xenial code check

content.raw: windows complains about the conversion here too. another cast?
content.html: windows complains about the conversion here too. another cast?

content.raw: windows complains about conversion from `long double` to `double`. should we do a cast of `IGN_DTOR(_deg)`?
content.html: windows complains about conversion from long double to double. should we do a cast of IGN_DTOR(_deg)?

content.raw:
hm...it looks like they don't work on Visual Studio 2013 though, requires 2015:

hm...it looks like they don't work on Visual Studio 2013 though, requires 2015:
